name: St. Paul's Cathedral of Abidjan
description: An architectural masterpiece by Aldo Spirito, its unique and bold structure evokes an elephant or a pilgrim's cloth. Its immense stained-glass windows depict biblical scenes with an African touch, making it a spiritual and modern symbol of Abidjan.
address: Near the Félix Houphouët-Boigny Stadium, Plateau, Abidjan.
transportation: Walking, Metered Taxi, Ride-hailing app (Yango, Uber)

name: Plateau District
description: The administrative and business heart of Abidjan, nicknamed 'Little Manhattan' for its skyscrapers. It's fascinating to walk around to feel the city's economic pulse and admire the architecture of its iconic towers.
transportation: SOTRA Bus, Taxi, Ride-hailing app, Water bus

name: Alassane Ouattara Bridge (5th Bridge)
description: The newest of Abidjan's major bridges, this impressive cable-stayed structure connects Le Plateau to Cocody. Its modern design and night lighting make it a new symbol of the city's development.
address: Connects Plateau and Cocody, over the Cocody Bay.

name: Henri Konan Bédié Bridge (HKB Bridge)
description: A major structure and engineering feat, this toll bridge connects Marcory and Cocody. Its unique inclined pylon is a strong visual signature in the Abidjan landscape. The view from the bridge is spectacular.

name: Treichville Sports Palace
description: The main indoor sports complex in Abidjan, this palace is the temple for indoor sports like basketball and boxing. Recently renovated, it hosts major national and international competitions in an electric atmosphere.

name: Abidjan Exhibition Center
description: An ultra-modern complex designed to host international fairs and mega-concerts. Its impressive architecture makes it a new hub for economic and event-based attraction for the city.
price: Paid access during exhibitions and events

name: Félix Houphouët-Boigny Stadium ('The Félicia')
description: The historic stadium of Abidjan, located in the heart of Le Plateau. Affectionately nicknamed 'Le Félicia,' it has been the scene of countless glorious moments in Ivorian football. It remains a strong symbol of the country's sporting history.

name: Bernard Binlin-Dadié Palace of Culture
description: Located on the edge of the lagoon, this complex is the main hub of artistic and cultural life in Abidjan. Its raw concrete architecture is bold. It is the venue for major concerts, plays, and shows.
